Type system:.text:
Do not re-build as-pattern type when a ground type annotation
  is given. This allows to work around problems with GADTs in as-patterns.

Runtime system:.text:
Re-introduce GC compaction for shared pools
  Adds a parallel compactor for the shared pools (which contain major heap
  blocks sized less than 128 words). Explicit only for now, on calls to
  `Gc.compact`.

Update Gc.quick_stat data at the end of major cycles and compaction
  This PR adds an additional caml_collect_gc_stats_sample_stw to the major heap
  cycling stw. This means that Gc.quick_stat now actually reflects the state of
  the heap after a major cycle or compaction.
Ensure Gc.compact does a full major before the compactor runs

Increase the detail of location information for debugging events to
  allow the end line number and character offset to be reported.

introduce `caml_ext_table_add_noexc` that does not
  raise `Out_of_memory` exceptions and use it inside the blocking sections
  of `caml_read_directory`.  Also, check for overflows in ext table sizes.
make sure `Bool_val(v)` has type `bool` in C++

Avoid using _Bool in public headers for the sake of C++
  compatibility

Constify constructors and flags tables in C code. Now these
  tables will go in the readonly segment, where they belong.
make instrumented time calculation more thread-safe on macOS.

introduce and use the `CAMLnoret` macro as
  a lighter alternative to `CAMLnoreturn_start` / `CAMLnoreturn_end`.
  Implement it so as to conform with C11, C23, C++11, C++17.

caml/stack.h: more abstract macros to describe OCaml stacks and
  how to traverse them, supporting more stack layouts.

deliver `Out_of_memory` exception if domain creation fails
  due to memory resource exhaustion.  It was previous always a `Failure`.
Discard out_channel buffered data on permanent I/O error
Simplifications and fixes to multicore systhreads implementation.

Execute preemptive systhread switching as a
  delayed pending action. This ensures that one can reason within the
  FFI that no mutation happens on the same domain when allocating on
  the OCaml heap from C, consistently with OCaml 4. This also fixes
  further bugs with the multicore systhreads implementation.

`Domain.spawn` no longer leaks its functional argument for
  the whole duration of the children domain lifetime.

Fix unsafety and deadlocks should an asynchronous exception
  arise at specific locations during domain creation and shutdown.
Add ThreadSanitizer support

Restore statmemprof functionality in part, with

Simplify dynamic bytecode loading in Meta.reify_bytecode
Fix an error-handling bug in caml_alloc_sprintf

Finish adapting the implementation of asynchronous actions for

  Do not crash if a signal handler is called from an unregistered C

Use syntax as sole determiner of arity
  This changes function arity to be based solely on the source program's
  parsetree. Previously, the heuristic for arity had more subtle heuristics
  that involved type information about patterns.  Function arity is important
  because it determines when a pattern match's effects run and is an input
  into the fast path for function application.
  This change affects tooling: it changes the function constructs in parsetree
  and typedtree.
  See https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/32 for the original RFC.

Clarify that the operations of a custom
  block must never access the OCaml runtime. The previous
  documentation only mentioned the main illicit usages. In particular,
  since OCaml 5.0, it is no longer safe to call
  `caml_remove_global_root` or `caml_remove_generational_global_root`
  from within the C finalizer of a custom block, or within the
  finalization function passed to `caml_alloc_final`. As a workaround,
  such a finalization operation can be registered with `Gc.finalize`
  instead, which guarantees to run the finalizer at a safe point.

Language features:.text: Add short syntax for generative functor types `() -> ...`

Remove old polymorphic variant syntax.
  With ``type t = [ `A | `B ]``, one could use the syntax `#t` in types,
  where it means the same thing as `[< t]`, and in patterns, where it means
  ``(`A | `B)``. The use of `#t` in types for polymorphic variants
  was deprecated since 2001, and is now removed. The syntax remains available
  in patterns, or for objects -- when `t` is a class type.

Add dedicated syntax for generative functor application.
  Previously, OCaml did not distinguish between `F ()` and
  `F (struct end)`, even though the latter looks applicative. Instead,
  the decision between generative and applicative functor application
  was made based on the type of `F`. With this patch, we now distinguish
  these two application forms; writing `F (struct end)` for a generative
  functor leads to new warning 73.
Make empty types (`type t = |`) immediate.

prohibit using classes through recursive modules

  universally quantified (in other words, the example above is now read
  as `'a 'r. ([< X of 'a ] as 'r) -> 'a`).

Runtime system:.text:
Runtime events counters fixes
  Fixes mismatch between OCaml and C APIs, removes events from 4.x that
  are not present in the 5.0 GC and adds some missing probes.

Runtime events buffer size OCAMLRUNPARAMS fix
  The runtime events buffer size can now be set via the 'e' OCAMLRUNPARAM.
  This is previously mistakenly enabled/disabled tracing instead.

Add environment variable to preserve runtime_events after exit
  If the environment variable OCAML_RUNTIME_EVENTS_PRESERVE exists then the
  runtime will not remove the runtime events ring buffers at exit. This
  makes tracing very short running programs more reliable.

Ring-buffer based runtime tracing (runtime_events)
  Runtime_events is a very low overhead runtime tracing system designed for
  continuous monitoring of OCaml applications.
do not use `-flat-namespace` linking for macOS.

Remove support for old, unprefixed C runtime function names
  such as `alloc`.  The new names prefixed with `caml_` must be used instead,
  such as `caml_alloc`.  Consequently, it is no longer needed to define
  `CAML_NAME_SPACE` to avoid bringing unprefixed names into scope: this is now
  the default behavior.
Do not register empty code fragments in natdynlink.

`caml_fatal_error_hook`, GC timing hooks, and
  `caml_scan_roots_hook` are now atomic variables. Restore GC timing
  hooks in multicore.

Add a public and thread-safe timing hook running at domain
  termination, after this domain has stopped running any OCaml code:
  `caml_domain_terminated_hook`. This can be useful for implementing
  domain-local state in C.

Add option to allocate fiber stacks and sigaltstacks with
  mmap(MAP_STACK) instead of malloc. This is exposed via a configure
  --enable-mmap-map-stack option, and is enabled by default on OpenBSD where
  it is mandatory.

Do not use mmap to allocate Caml_state.
  In order to reduce virtual memory usage, we dynamically allocate
  the domain_state structure.
Use strerror_r for reentrant error string conversion.

Do not use Begin_roots/End_roots macros in
  the runtime system.  Also fix a missing root registration in the
  implementation of Unix.write on Windows.
Track GC work for all managed bigarray allocations
Use 4.12 value macros and helpers in C code
Fix handling of fiber stack cache with multiple domains

Respect user provided maximum stack space
  Make sure the stack we initially request is sized accordingly to
  the user provided settings. tmc/stack_space is also updated by
  this PR in order to account for this change.

Increase the default limit for the stack size to 128 Mi words,
  i.e. 1 Gib for 64-bit platforms and 512 Mib for 32-bit platforms.

An ISO C 2011 compliant compiler, including full support for atomic
  types, is now required to build the OCaml runtime system.

Implement quality treatment for
  asynchronous actions in multicore. Reimplement the old behaviour of
  `caml_process_pending*` for multicore.
Ensure that GC is not invoked from bounds check failures
Fix data race on Windows file descriptors

pass 'flags' metadata to root scanners, to optimize stack
  scanning in the bytecode interpreter.
  Changes the interface of user-provided root-scanning hooks.

in the C interface, `&Field(v, i)` now has type `volatile value *`
  instead of `value *` in OCaml 4.  This makes the memory model
  for mixed OCaml/C code better defined, but can cause warnings or type
  errors in user C code.

To help debugging, `Caml_state`
  now dynamically checks that the domain lock is held, and fails
  otherwise (with a fatal error at most entry points of the C API, or
  systematically in debug mode). A new variable `Caml_state_opt` is
  introduced, and is `NULL` when the domain lock is not held. This
  allows to test from C code if the current thread holds the lock of
  its domain.

The serialization format of custom blocks changed in 4.08,
  but the deserializer would still support the pre-4.08 format.  OCaml
  5.x removed support for this old format; provide a clear error message
  in this case.

More prudent deallocation of alternate signal stack

Speed up GC by prefetching during marking
Stack overflow detection and naked pointers checking for ARM64

Increase the number of integer registers used for
  parameter passing on PowerPC (16 registers) and on s390x (8 registers).

  and long register allocation times.

Tail calls with up to 64 arguments are guaranteed to be compiled

Enforce boolean conditions for the native backend
Ensure that build_apply respects Lambda.max_arity
Ensure that functions are evaluated after their arguments
Ensure right-to-left evaluation of arguments in cmm_helpers

Standard library:.text:
Add UTF tools, codecs and validations to the Uchar, Bytes and
  String modules.
Annotate `Uchar.t` with immediate attribute

`Filename.chop_suffix name suff` now checks that `suff`

add Random.bits32, Random.bits64, Random.nativebits

remove Obj.marshal and Obj.unmarshal

Add In_channel and Out_channel modules.

add Out_channel.set_buffered and Out_channel.is_buffered to control

Add over 40 new functions in Seq.

add detailed information about the current version of OCaml

add new ephemeron API for forward compatibility with Multicore

Add Thread.set_uncaught_exception_handler and

Ensure all C functions in the Unix library are prefixed with

Release bytecode only after collecting backtrace information

Show "#help;; for help" at toplevel startup

add M, m, n options of the OCAMLRUNPARAM to manual and man page

Add description of C compiler on macOS and Windows platforms.
Document exceptions raised by Unix module functions on Windows

Give more precise error when disambiguation could not

Produce more detailed error messages that contain full error traces

add naked_pointers to ocamlc -config exporting NAKED_POINTERS from

Fix single-line source highlighting in the

Clarify warning 57 (Ambiguous or-pattern variables under guard)

add unset directive to ocamltest to clear environment variables before
  running tests.
Change representation of class signatures
-dtypedtree, print more explicitly extra nodes in pattern ast.

Make field_kind and commutable abstract, enforcing correct access

add a -dump-dir flag, which redirects all debugging printer

Remove the distinction between 32-bit aligned and 64-bit aligned
  64-bit floats in Cmm.memory_chunk.
Pun labelled arguments with type constraint in function applications.

Remove unused `cstr_normal` field from the `constructor_description`
  type
Don't repeat environment entries in Typemod.check_type_decl
refactor caml_sys_random_seed to ease future Multicore changes

Move logic to get the type path from a constructor return type in
  Types
Do not use ghost locations for type constraints

fix an exponential blow-up when typechecking nested module
  types
Evaluate signature substitutions lazily
Fix compilation time regression introduced in 4.08
Expose more Pprintast functions
Outcometree: introduce a record type for constructors
refactor the compilation of the 'switch' construct
avoid global C state in the RE engine for the "str" library
Expose descriptions in Warnings module
Always build ocamltoplevel.cmxa
Expose Parse.module_type and Parse.module_expr

Add X86_proc.with_internal_assembler for temporarily changing the

Allow the assembler and loader to be substituted in ocamlnat, for

Add "Shape" information to the cmt files. Shapes are an

strong call-by-need reduction for shapes

Build system:.text:
Disable DT_TEXTREL warnings on x86 32 bit architecture by passing
  -Wl,-z,notext in mksharedlib and mkmaindll. Fixes relocation issues, reported

Simplify the installation of man pages
Stop installing extract_crc

Compile with -d2VolatileMetadata- on supporting versions of Visual
  Studio. This suppresses the addition of .voltbl sections and eliminates

Bug fixes:.text:
Wrong unmarshaling of function pointers in debugger mode.
  This was causing ocamldebug to crash when running some user-defined printers.
Improve detection of ambiguity in case bodies.

Add CFI directives to RISC-V runtime and asmcomp.
  This allows stacktraces to work in gdb through C and OCaml calls.

Field kinds should be kept when copying types
  Losing the sharing meant that one could desynchronize them between several
  occurrences of self, allowing a method to be both public and hidden,
  which broke type soundness.
Fix detection of immediate64 types through unboxed types.
Some typechecker optimisations

Stack overflow recovery in ocamlopt for AMD64/Linux and ARM/Linux
  was not restoring the minor heap pointer correctly
Fix freshening substitutions on imported modules

Fix detection of CC as gcc in configure (allow for

  rather than a basename.

Add --enable-native-toplevel to configure to enable installing
  ocamlnat as part of the main build (default is not to install it)
Fix ident collision in includemod

Fix cast of more strictly aligned pointer in win32unix
  implementation of stat

Type-check toplevel terms in the native toplevel in the same way as
  the bytecode toplevel. In particular, this fixes the loss of type variable
  names in the native toplevel.
Uncaught unify exception from `build_as_type`
fix miscompilation of method delegation

Bad interaction between ambivalent types and subtyping
  coercions

avoid internal typechecker errors when checking signature
  inclusion in presence of incompatible types.

Display the result of `let _ : <type> = <expr>` in the native
  toplevel, as in the bytecode toplevel.

`Obj.reachable_words` could crash if called after a marshaling
  operation in `NO_SHARING` mode.
Wrong type inferred from existential types

Exception handlers restore the rbp register when using frame-pointers
  on amd64.
Do not pass -no-pie to the C compiler on musl/arm64
A recursive type constraint fails on 4.14

Fix integer overflow on 64-bit Windows when indexing bigarrays (which
  could lead to a segmentation fault).

Bug fixes.text: fix a bug with classes named "row"

Progress towards Multicore:.text:
Safepoints
  Add poll points to native generated code. These are effectively
  zero-sized allocations and fix some signal and remembered set
  issues. Also multicore prerequisite.

do not cache the young_limit GC variable in a processor register.
  This affects the ARM64, PowerPC and RISC-V ports, making signal handling
  and minor GC triggers more reliable, at the cost of a small slowdown.

Language features (highlights):.text:
Allow to name existentials in pattern-matching
  One can now write '(Cstr (type a) (x, y : int * a))' to give a name to
  existentials freshly introduced by GADT constructors.

Compiler user-interface and warnings (h.text: Improve error messages for functor application and functor types.

enable warning 6 [labels-omitted] by default.
  The following now warns:
    let f ~x y = ... in f 3 5
  the callsite (f 3 5) has to be turned into (f ~x:3 5).
  This prevents mistakes where two arguments of the same types are swapped.
  (Note: Dune already enables this warning by default.)

add an odoc mode for the documentation
  of the standard library and compiler library

Standard library (highlights):.text:
Add some missing C99 float operations.  `Stdlib` now contains
  the inverse hyperbolic functions
    `acosh`, `asinh`, and `atanh`.
  These functions were also added to module `Stdlib.Float` together with

Add a generic backward dataflow analyzer and use it to speed up
  liveness analysis

Avoid compilation times exponential in the nesting of loops
  in the spilling and reloading passes

Internal typechecker changes (highlight.text:
Maintain more structural information in type-checking errors
  A mostly-internal change that preserves more information in errors
  during type checking; most significantly, it split the errors from
  unification, moregen, and type equality into three different types.
Make Types.type_expr a private type, and abstract marking mechanism

Runtime system (highlights):.text:
Switch the default allocation policy to best-fit and adjust
  the default overhead parameter accordingly.
Stack overflow detection and naked pointers checking for ARM64

Change compaction-triggering heuristic: use the overhead measured
  by the previous GC cycle instead of an indirect (and noisy) computation
  of the current overhead.
Fix major GC work accounting (the GC was running too fast).

Let-punning
  Allow 'let* x in ...' and 'let%ext x in ...' as shorthand for

Ensure modules compiled with -afl-instrument can still link on

Add -help/--help option to ocamlrun.
Minor clean-ups in runtime/io.c and runtime/caml/io.h

Tweak the naked pointers checker so that processes which trigger the
  alarm always exit with non-zero status (i.e. exit(0) becomes exit(70)).

Simplify and improve the Windows-specific code that connects
  to the debugger via a socket.
Fix a segfault in a corner case of compaction (reported in #9853)

Dynamically allocate alternate signal stacks to
   accommodate changes in Glibc 2.34.

Add an optional invariants check on Cmm, which can be activated

Allow CSE of immutable loads across stores
improvements in ARM64 code generation (constants, sign extensions)
Better code-generation for inlined comparisons
Optimise Int32.unsigned_to_int

Fix incorrect instruction selection for string constant loads

Fix destroyed_at_c_call on RISC-V

Add Array.fold_left_map.

Seq.(concat : 'a t t -> 'a t)

Add fold_left, fold_right, exists and for_all to String/Bytes
small optimization of Stdlib.{frexp,modf}.
Add {Int,Int32,Int64,Nativeint}.{min,max}.
Add Format.print_bytes and Format.pp_print_bytes.

Add `Unix.realpath`
Remove expensive debug assertion from dynlink.
Consider that IPv6 is always enabled on Windows.

Map WSA error code to Unix errno for sockopt and getsockname

Properly return EBADF on error in Unix.descr_of_{in,out}_channel on

keep refactoring the pattern-matching compiler

Per-function environment for Emit

Language features (highlights):.text:
Injectivity annotations
  One can now mark type parameters as injective, which is useful for
  abstract types:
    module Vec : sig type !'a t end = struct type 'a t = 'a array end
  On non-abstract types, this can be used to check the injectivity of
  parameters. Since all parameters of record and sum types are by definition
  injective, this only makes sense for type abbreviations:
    type !'a t = 'a list
  Note that this change required making the regularity check stricter.

Runtime system (highlights):.text:
Introduce a naked pointers checker mode to the runtime
  (configure option --enable-naked-pointers-checker).  Alarms are printed
  when the garbage collector finds out-of-heap pointers that could
  cause a crash in no-naked-pointers mode.

EINTR-based signal handling.
  When a signal arrives, avoid running its OCaml handler in the middle
  of a blocking section. Instead, allow control to return quickly to
  a polling point where the signal handler can safely run, ensuring that
  I/O locks are not held while it runs. A polling point was removed from
  caml_leave_blocking_section, and one added to caml_raise.

Add `Val_none`, `Some_val`, `Is_none`, `Is_some`,
  `caml_alloc_some`, and `Tag_some`. As these macros are sometimes defined by
  authors of C bindings, this change may cause warnings/errors in case of
  redefinition.

Memprof: guarantee that an allocation callback is always run
  in the same thread the allocation takes place
Track custom blocks (e.g. Bigarray) with Memprof

Change representation of function closures so that code pointers
  can be easily distinguished from environment variables
More efficient management of code fragments.

Runtime system:.text:
Add a best-fit allocator for the major heap; still
  experimental, it should be much better than current allocation
  policies (first-fit and next-fit) for programs with large heaps,
  reducing both GC cost and memory usage.
  This new best-fit is not (yet) the default; set it explicitly with
  OCAMLRUNPARAM="a=2" (or Gc.set from the program). You may also want
  to increase the `space_overhead` parameter of the GC (a percentage,
  80 by default), for example OCAMLRUNPARAM="o=85", for optimal
  speed.

Introduce a state table in the runtime to contain the global variables.
  (The Multicore runtime will have one such state for each domain.)
   This changes the status of some internal variables of the OCaml runtime;
   in many cases the header file originally defining the internal variable
   provides a compatibility macro with the old name, but programs
   re-defining those variables by hand need to be fixed.

New C functions caml_process_pending_actions{,_exn} in
  caml/signals.h, intended for executing all pending actions inside
  long-running C functions (requested minor and major collections,
  signal handlers, finalisers, and memprof callbacks). The function
  caml_process_pending_actions_exn returns any exception arising
  during their execution, allowing resources to be cleaned-up before
  re-raising.

Allocation functions are now guaranteed not to
  trigger any OCaml callback when called from C. In long-running C
  functions, this can be replaced with calls to
  caml_process_pending_actions at safe points.
  Side effect of this change: in bytecode mode, polling for
  asynchronous callbacks is performed at every minor heap allocation,
  in addition to function calls and loops as in previous OCaml
  releases.

caml_check_urgent_gc is now guaranteed not to trigger any
  finaliser. In long-running C functions, this can be replaced
  with calls to caml_process_pending_actions at safe points.
Ensure Gc.minor_words remains accurate after a GC.

  one operator character after the dot symbol to the standard indexing
  operators: e,g ".%()", ".?[]", ".@{}<-":
    let ( .%() ) = List.nth in [0; 1; 2].%(1)
  After this change, functions or methods with an explicit polymorphic type
  annotation and of which the first argument is optional now requires a space
  between the dot and the question mark,
  e.g. "<f:'a.?opt:int->unit>" must now be written "<f:'a. ?opt:int->unit>".

Support inherited field in object type expression
    type t = < m : int >

  UTF-8 encoding of the Unicode character.

  at configure time or at compile time.

Private extensible variants
  This change breaks code relying on the undocumented ability to export
  extension constructors for abstract type in signature. Briefly,
    module type S = sig
      type t
      type t += A
    end

Arg.align now optionally uses the tab character '\t' to
  separate the "unaligned" and "aligned" parts of the documentation string. If
  tab is not present, then space is used as a fallback. Allows to have spaces in
  the unaligned part, which is useful for Tuple options.

Format, add symbolic formatters that output symbolic
  pretty-printing items. New fields have been added to the
  formatter_out_functions record, thus this change will break any code building
  such record from scratch.
  When building Format.formatter_out_functions values redefining the out_spaces
  field, "{ fmt_out_funs with out_spaces = f; }" should be replaced by
  "{ fmt_out_funs with out_spaces = f; out_indent = f; }" to maintain the old
  behavior.

Fixed the divergence of the Pervasives module between the stdlib
  and threads implementations.  In rare circumstances this can change the
  behavior of existing applications: the implementation of Pervasives.close_out
  used when compiling with thread support was inconsistent with the manual.
  It will now not suppress exceptions escaping Pervasives.flush anymore.
  Developers who want the old behavior should use Pervasives.close_out_noerr
  instead.  The stdlib implementation, used by applications not compiled
  with thread support, will now only suppress Sys_error exceptions in
  Pervasives.flush_all.  This should allow exceedingly unlikely assertion
  exceptions to escape, which could help reveal bugs in the standard library.

Release documentation.text: The official name of the language is now OCaml.

Language features.text:
Added Generalized Algebraic Data Types (GADTs) to the language.
  See chapter "Language extensions" of the reference manual for documentation.

It is now possible to omit type annotations when packing and unpacking
  first-class modules. The type-checker attempts to infer it from the context.
  Using the -principal option guarantees forward compatibility.

New (module M) and (module M : S) syntax in patterns, for immediate
  unpacking of a first-class module.

Warning 28 is now enabled by default.
New option -absname to use absolute paths in error messages
Optimize away compile-time beta-redexes, e.g. (fun x y -> e) a b.
Added option -bin-annot to dump the AST with type annotations.

Added lots of new warnings about unused variables, opens, fields,
  constructors, etc.

New meaning for warning 7: it is now triggered when a method is overridden
  with the "method" keyword.  Use "method!" to avoid the warning.

    . Supports both Linux/EABI (armel) and Linux/EABI+VFPv3 (armhf).

    . Added support for position-independent code, natdynlink, profiling and
      exception backtraces.

  annotations, enabling in particular precise stack backtraces with
  the gdb debugger. Currently supported for x86 32-bits and 64-bits only.

Installation procedure.text:
Compiler internals are now installed in `ocamlc -where`/compiler-libs.
  The files available there include the .cmi interfaces for all compiler
  modules, plus the following libraries:
      ocamlcommon.cma/.cmxa     modules common to ocamlc, ocamlopt, ocaml
      ocamlbytecomp.cma/.cmxa   modules for ocamlc and ocaml
      ocamloptcomp.cma/.cmxa    modules specific to ocamlopt
      ocamltoplevel.cma         modules specific to ocaml
   (#8255, #4653, frequently-asked feature).

Some .cmi for toplevel internals that used to be installed in
  `ocamlc -where` are now to be found in  `ocamlc -where`/compiler-libs.
  Add "-I +compiler-libs" where needed.

toplevellib.cma is no longer installed because subsumed by
  ocamlcommon.cma ocamlbytecomp.cma ocamltoplevel.cma

Added a configuration option (-with-debug-runtime) to compile and install
  a debug version of the runtime system, and a compiler option
  (-runtime-variant) to select the debug runtime.
